data.name: Simple handlebars engine #1
data.description:
# Simple Handlebars engine #1

In this kata you will be writing a simplified version of a [handlebars render engine](http://handlebarsjs.com/).

This engine (your function) should turn a simple handlebars template with some data into a new generated string.

## example

```
render('hello {{name}}',{name: 'joel'}); //outputs: 'hello joel'
render('ping {{ deep.pong }}',{deep: {pong: 'joel')}); //outputs: 'ping joel'
```
 
 
 ## Requirements
 
 This is a simple version of the kata. You don't have to worry about error handling or any conditions/code blocks, yet.
 
 * you need to have a Render function, accepting 2 parameters
  * first paramters is a string: the handlebars template to render.
  * second parameter is an object: the data to use for rendering the template
 * a single handlebar `{` should be shown in the output
 * a handlebar can be escaped by using a blackslash: `\{{`
 * when data doesn't exists, it shouldn't render anything: `render('t {{t}}',{r:2})` => 't '
 * when invalid data-acces, also render nothing: `render('t {{t.t}}',{t:2})` => 't '
 * Handlebars defines the following bracket notation, which is used: `{{t.[key]}}`
 * Using `/` instead `of` . is deprecated in the spec, so it wont be tested: `{{t/key}}`
 * No html encoding of content is needed in this kata. (note that this is, though, the default behaviour for a double bracket expression in handlebars).  
 
## Note from the creator

You can solve it by either replacing or 'compiling' the template. Note that they both have their downsides:

* Replacing is a rather slow process, so running the same template multiple times will be generally slower than compiling
* Compiling, while it is blazing fast to run, the drawbacks are that the compilation generally can take longer than a single run of replacing. Also Compiling dynamic templates will lead to the side effect of slowly building up on memory usage (since every compiled template == code that is loaded into memory)

Don't worry, neither edge case is tested in this kata!

Good luck!
